Then there's the School House Rock! Rocks with Ween, the Lemonheads, and Biz Markie doing Three is the Magic Number, and My Hero, Zero and such. There’s the For the Kids album, it has a lot of different people (Cake, Wilco, Sarah McLachlan) doing Mahna Mahna, and Rainbow Connection and the like.

Then there’s the School House Rock! Rocks with Ween, the Lemonheads, and Biz Markie doing Three is the Magic Number, and My Hero, Zero and such.

My children always had very eclectic tastes. Joni Mitchell had a children’s bedtime album that both kids loved. Tom Pease, a Midwestern singer/entertainer, has several excellent albums out. He’s even better live.
